result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph M Connolly was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Person Duty to Aid/Report Crime, a class C misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.34(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Order for payment of Atty. David Zarwell as appointed defense counsel covering cases 15CF221 &  15CF366 in the amount of  $223.30.
FINANCIAL NOTES:  Atty fee assessment in case 15CF221
with attachments and proposed order for payment of court appointed defense counsel fees from Attorney Zarwell in the amount of $223.30 .

Cases 15CF221 and 15CF366 called together at 10:47am [mo]
Defendant Joseph M Connolly in court with Attorney David Zarwell.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance

As to Case 15CF221:
--DA Happ gives arguments to allow admission of the Amended Information
--The Court grants the amendment of the Information 

The Court indicates from this point forward it will be using the Amended Information in 15CF221 and Case 15CF366 as Amended in the CCS

The Court amends by its own hand language is the CCS regarding 15CF366, changing from being charged with a 'felony' to 'misdemeanor'; the Court also strikes the language referring to in the Town of Raymond

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " Guilty " entered on Case 15CF221, Counts #1 and #2 and case 15CF366 as Amended; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

The Court adopts the proposed settlement of the Parties; gives basis

On all counts, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--maintain absolute sobriety; no presence in bars or taverns
--to confirm with JESO that DNA has been provided; if has not then provide DNA sample upon demand
--to pay statutory court costs on all counts 
--to pay court appointed attorney fees

As to Case 15CF221: Days credit for time already served:  3  days
As to Case 15CF366: Days credit for time already served:  0  days

recess: 11:28am
Court's response to Clerks' Note: This is in anticipation of the upcoming plea and sentence. They will make an oral motion then.

Cases 15CF221 and 15CF366 called together at 11:51am [mo]
Defendant Joseph M Connolly in court with Attorney David Zarwell.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court summarizes an off the record discussion with Counsel re: Mr. Connolly's ineligibility for SPD representation at this time

The Court amends the Petition for Counsel that was submitted by Mr. Connolly to include both cases
The Court reviews the Petition with Mr. Connolly
The Court finds Mr. Connolly indigent
The Court appoints Atty. Zarwell as Counsel for Mr. Connolly on Cases 15CF221 and 15CF366
The Court orders Mr. Connolly to pay towards attorney fees in the amount of $100 per month beginnig 3/16/16 and on the 16th day of each month, until further directed by the Court
recess: 12:00pm

NEXT: Plea/Sentencing Hearing on 2/26/16 at 10:30am
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Attorney David Zarwell. Repayment at the rate of $100 per month until the total sum is paid. The first payment shall be made on March 16, 2016. Payments shall be made to the Clerk of Court

Cases 15CF366 and 15CF221 called together at 10:50am [mo]
Defendant Joseph M Connolly in court with Attorney David Zarwell.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Zarwell notes that he is only SPD appointed on case 15CF221

As to Case 15CF366 (Initial Appearance occurs):
The Court verifies Mr. Connolly's date of birth and address
The Court inquires of ADA Teuber the charging language of the Criminal Complaint including the wrong venue 'Racine County'
--ADA Teuber indicates that this is an error, does not object to the Court amending the Criminal Complaint
Atty. Zarwell reminds the Court that he is not appointed on this case
recess:10:54am--reconvene: 10:56am [[to allow review of the Crimnal Complaint]]
The Court inquires of Atty. Zarwell his willingness to accept a Court Appointment to Case 15CF366 for purposes of Initial Appearnce
--Atty. Zarwell accepts this appointment for matters of Initial Appearance

ADA Teuber orally motions for the Criminal Complaint to read City of Jefferson and County of Jefferson
--No objection from Atty. Zarwell
--The Court amends the Criminal Complaint by its own hand

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2500   Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--comply with any existing bond conditions
--booking at the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today

As to Case 15CF317: 
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance 
Atty. Zarwell requests a joint PTC and STC be scheduled for both cases

recess: 11:04am 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 1/6/16 at 3:00pm   (2) Status Conference on 2/16/16 at 10:30am

Case called at 8:53am [mo]
Defendant Joseph M Connolly in court with Attorney David Zarwell.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance

Mr.Connolly waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered on both counts
--No demand for speedy trial 
recess: 8:59am

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 10/28/15 at 11:00am    (2) Status Conference on 12/4/15 at 10:30am

Case called at 8:57am [mo]
Defendant Joseph M Connolly in court with Attorney David Zarwell.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

Atty. Zarwell requests a Preliminary Hearing out 3 to 4 weeks. 
--No objection from the State

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
recess:9:00am 

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 9/28/15 at 8:30am
and inspection, Defendant's (with fax cover sheet)
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[MK] case called at 1:18pm. 
Defendant Joseph M Connolly appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert (PD appearing for bond purposes only).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Right to counsel given. 
Mr. Connolly verifies that the name, date of birth, and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $5,000 signature bond, with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--no contact with Angel Banuelos except at work for work purposes only
--no presence at the residence of Angel Banuelos 
--no discussion of the facts of the case with Ryan Parsely
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, package houses
recess 1:23pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 8/12/15 at 9:00am  (2) Status Conference on 9/1/15 at 8:30am.
